user_review: SO happy this restaurant opened up next to me. MeiWei is a small dumpling restaurant in NDG/Westmount run by a cute Chinese family. The wife takes the orders and the husband cooks / brings out food. The service is great and they are very nice. The resto is clean unlike a lot of dumpling places in Montreal. But most importantly, the dumplings are delicious! I got 1/2 fried, 1/2 steamed lamb & coriander (sooo good) and my sis got steamed 1/2 beef curry, 1/2 veggie. The veggie was kinda boring compared to the flavour bombs from the meat ones. Will 100% go back and order these delicious morcels of heaven again. The best part? There's a whole other part of the menu to discover, with yummy sounding appetizers!
(Pre-COVID) Cute and cozy little place with nice dumplings and good family-friendly service.

Super yummy, super affordable, casual little dumpling restaurant! Good place for getherings with friends, family, partner, whatever! Definitely get the peanut butter sauce with your dumplings, you won't regret!!

Terrasse is quaint and cosy. Service was good. Tried the spring rolls , steamed beef curry dumplings and the boiled lamb coriander dumplings. Overall, dumplings were quite good (freshly made and had nice texture) but personally, I found that they lacked a little in flavour compared to other dumpling joints in Montreal.

Small shop, a few tables bur a good variety of dumplings. Very quick and friendly service !!I tasted; lamb-cumim and shrimp scallops pork. Took plain shrimp to steam homeGood seasoning and fresh ingredients. The dough is the traditional slightly more "al dente" compared to the cantonese style which rice starch to soften the dough and make it more trans lucid.  I prefer the al dente dough but the filling was was crumbling instead of remaining  firmer more like a meatball. But overall they deserve a thumbs up as they are trying hard and i am sure they eiil one of the top dumpling house in Montréal

Another great find for Chinese dumplings. I stopped by for some takeout after work. Decided on one order of curry chicken dumplings. They turned out to be very good, even after eating them 20-25 minutes after receiving them. They have a nice selection of dumplings, with a few other menu items as well. Can't wait to come back to try more. The restaurant itself is a nice little place. They even have a few tables on a terrace. The owners (I'm assuming they were the owners) were really friendly. I will definitely return for more.

Yummy dumplings alert!! Ordered curry chicken and beef onion dumplings from here for the first time. I always eat vegetarian dumplings because I don't like the way the meat in dumplings tastes. But I decided to try chicken dumplings this time. Result:  no regrets. Loved the curry chicken dumplings. And my husband enjoyed the beef dumplings. It's a bit far from where I live so I don't think I would go to the restaurant. So I am really happy they're available on UberEats! Already raved about it to my friends.
Love the dumplings, many varieties, all freshly made!Great staff, so happy to have this resto in our neighbourhood!

Heaven in your mouth. I am so thrilled that there is an authentic dumpling restaurant in my neighbourhood. I really love the lamb and coriander steamed dumplings. Handmade with love. It's worth the wait.

Delicious!!! So happy this opened in this neighbourhood. Staff is so attentive, smiley!A beautiful addition to the area!

Ordered the peanut butter dumplings, pork and chives dumplings and the crispy pork with katsu sauce.Unfortunately the pork and chives dumplings tasted no different from the type you can buy from a grocery store, from the taste of the ingredients inside to the exact thickness of the dumpling skin.The pork with katsu was underwhelming - the pork tasted like it had been placed in a microwave to be defrosted.The peanut butter dumplings were the best part of the meal, even if the sauce was very watery.All in all a disappointing experience.

Update: also, BEST wonton soup ever. Not your run of the mill wonton soup at all. Super delicate and fresh broth and wontons. The large size includes noodles--it's perfect soup for the cold weather. Add some of the chili sauce--so good. Veggie dumplings (got the tofu mushroom) are also the tastiest vegetarian dumplings I've had in Montreal. Hot teas are also excellent. This place has it all--outstanding food, service, and atmosphere.

Dumplings par excellence! These dumplings are sheer perfection. Tender, fresh, and beautifully handcrafted. Vegetarian and pescatarian options abound. The seaweed salad with garlic and vinegar was just what the doctor asked for on a cold winters' day. Service with a smile. Two thumbs up!
